content: OCBC 360 Bank Account Credit Card Asked by Jayden NgAsked on 04 Sep 2018Should I switch to DBS multipler? Currently using OCBC 360. Assume I have 70K, will hit $600/$800 credit card spend and hit 3 bill. ?3 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Assuming salary credit $2000​For OCBC 360:Base interest: 0.05Credit salary:1.2Pay 3 bills online through GIRO with total amount of at least S$150: 0.3Spend min. $500 on OCBC credit cards: 0.3Total: 1.85%​For DBS Multiplier:Base interest: 0.05Credit salary: 1.55Total: 1.60%​However, if your salary credit is $5000 or more monthly, or have a 2nd salary credit (min. $2000), then DBS Multiplier is better. As it stands currently with the information given, OCBC 360 gives better interest.1 comment2
Serene Toh21 Sep 2018Add on. If got more than $70,000. Can consider setting up another account without salary crediting like UOB ONE etc, to get interest for the amount above the base.

JianHao SooLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Do note that Multiplier bonus interest is capped at $50k :) May want to consider putting the other $20k at other platforms such as CIMB Fast Saver/SSB0 comments0

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018You might want to check out this calculator made by seedly: https://seedly.sg/tools/savings-account-calculator​Fill in the various fields, and the calculator will tell you which savings account is best for your current situation :)0 comments0
